Package org.frogger.gameSettings

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.frogger.gameSettings.Game
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Components
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GameEasyLevel, GameHardLevel, GameMediumLevel
    public abstract class Game
extends java.lang.Object
implements Components

    Game

    This is an abstract class implementing Components interface, which can be inherented by games in different modes.

    This class is essential to create a game UI and add basic game elements to the game board.

    Since:
    20/11/2019
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Pinyuan Feng (scypf1)
    See Also:
    Components

    • Method Detail

      • getStage

        public static World getStage()
        Gets background

        This method is set to be static making it easier to call and access the private static variable animal. Because in other parts of code, we may use background to add additional game elements.

        Returns:
        World -- game background
        See Also:
        World

      • startGame

        public void startGame()
        Sets the game background and starts the game

        This method sets a scene to the stage and adds buttons and texts to the scene.

        This method contains GameTimerController to achieve animation and GameController to set JavaFX components.

        Specified by:
        startGame in interface Components
        See Also:
        GameTimerController, GameController
